content: No, microwaves do not cause cancer. Microwaves are a type of electromagnetic radiation with relatively low energy, and they do not have enough energy to damage DNA or cause cancer. The World Health Organization and other scientific organizations have extensively studied microwaves and have found no evidence to suggest that they cause cancer. It's important to note that all microwave ovens are designed with safety features to prevent any leakage of microwaves, and they are rigorously tested to ensure that they meet safety standards. So, you can use your microwave oven with confidence, knowing that it is safe to use.
